sn1.37:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Great Wood, together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants, all of whom were perfected ones.
sn1.37:4.3: And the majority of the deities from ten solar systems had gathered to see the Buddha and the Saṅgha of mendicants.
sn1.37:4.4: Then four deities of the Pure Abodes, aware of what was happening, thought:
sn1.37:4.7: Why don’t we go to the Buddha
sn1.37:4.8: and each recite our individual verses in his presence?”
sn1.37:5.2: as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm,
sn1.37:5.4: he vanished from the Pure Abodes and reappeared in front of the Buddha.
sn1.37:5.5: They bowed to the Buddha and stood to one side.
sn1.37:5.6: Standing to one side, one deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.37:6.1: “There’s a great congregation in the woods,
sn1.37:6.2: a host of gods have assembled.
sn1.37:6.3: We’ve come to this righteous congregation
sn1.37:7.1: Then another deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.37:8.2: they’ve straightened out their own minds.
sn1.37:8.3: Like a charioteer who has taken the reins,
sn1.37:8.4: the astute ones protect their senses.”
sn1.37:9.1: Then another deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.37:10.1: “Having cut the stake and cut the bar,
sn1.37:10.2: they’re unmoved, with boundary post uprooted.
sn1.37:10.4: the young dragons tamed by the seer.”
sn1.37:11.1: Then another deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.37:12.1: “Anyone who has gone to the Buddha for refuge
sn1.37:12.2: won’t go to a plane of loss.
sn1.37:12.3: After giving up this human body,
sn1.37:12.4: they swell the hosts of gods.”
